item.title: Optimal placement of solar panels for better observation of solar energy
item.description: Optimal panel placement is crucial for maximizing energy production from your solar panel system. Here are some key considerations: Orientation: In the Northern Hemisphere, panels should face true south to capture the maximum amount of sunlight throughout the day. In the Southern Hemisphere, panels should face true north. Tilt Angle: The tilt angle of the panels should be approximately equal to
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Choose the Inverters which are more efficient to work with Solar panels?
item.description: Selecting an efficient inverter is crucial for maximizing the energy production of your solar panel system. Here are key considerations for choosing an efficient solar inverter: Type of Inverter: String Inverters: These are connected to multiple solar panels in a series. They are cost-effective but the performance of the whole string can be affected if one panel is shaded or underperforming.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to choose solar panels which are more efficient?
item.description: Choosing efficient solar panels is crucial for maximizing the energy production of your solar system. Here are some key factors to consider when selecting high-efficiency solar panels: Conversion Efficiency: Look for panels with a high conversion efficiency. This indicates the percentage of sunlight that the panel can convert into electricity. Higher efficiency panels will generate more power
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Brown rice vs White rice
item.description: Brown rice and white rice are two different types of rice that undergo varying levels of processing. Here are some key differences between brown rice and white rice: Processing: Brown rice is the whole grain rice that retains its bran, germ and endosperm layers, while white rice has had its bran and germ removed, leaving only the endosperm. Nutritional Content: Brown rice is considered more nut
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to make a compost without worm/kitchen composting/organic composting
item.description: Composting is a great way to reduce waste and create nutrient-rich soil for your garden. While worm composting and kitchen composting are popular methods, there are other ways to make compost without using worms or organic kitchen waste.
